title: Pentium (original)
summary: The Pentium is a microprocessor that was introduced by Intel on March 22, 1993, as the first CPU in the Pentium brand.[2][3] It was instruction set compatible with the 80486 but was a new and very different microarchitecture design. The P5 Pentium was the first superscalar x86 microarchitecture and the world's first superscalar microprocessor to be in mass production. It included dual integer pipelines, a faster floating-point unit, wider data bus, separate code and data caches, and many other techniques and features to enhance performance and support security, encryption, and multiprocessing, for workstations and servers.
